criterion: Provides a clear and concise summary of the HPI (History of Present Illness) without missing any crucial information.
Mentions the importance of providing more details about the duration, severity, or associated symptoms to better assess the situation.
Incorrectly advises the user to ignore their symptoms and rest at home without seeking medical attention.
Suggests that the user consider seeking medical attention immediately due to the unclear nature of the symptoms.
Provides overly technical or medical jargon that may confuse the user.
Asks for clarification on specific symptoms or details to better understand the user's situation.
Mentions the importance of considering other potential causes of dizziness, such as medication side effects or underlying medical conditions.
Incorrectly states that the user should only consider going to the ER if they experience severe symptoms.
Provides a clear explanation of the importance of seeking medical attention when unsure about the severity of symptoms.
